channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Small Businesses, Big Ouches. These 7 Weird Workplace Injuries Stand Out
item.description: An insurer’s accident report found half the incidents small business owners reported could have been avoided, especially the strangest ones.

item.title: SNAP payments slashed to 50% as federal shutdown stretches into its second month
item.description: Over the past several days, millions of low-income Americans who use SNAP, the nation’s biggest food aid program, have been left wondering how they wi...

item.title: Sam Altman sometimes wishes OpenAI were public so haters could short the stock—‘I would love to see them get burned on that’
item.description: Despite reports, Altman said OpenAI has no specific timeline on going public.

item.title: Most Gen-Z Employees See Traditional Career Paths Coming to an End
item.description: New survey data finds many Gen Zers pursuing multiple gigs as an alternative to long careers and working for a single employer.

item.title: Ferrari to release crypto token to let wealthy fans take part in 499P auction
item.description: The Italian car maker says the 100 top token owners will be able to bid on the luxury car

item.title: Elon Musk’s Solution to Data Centers: Just Put Them in Space
item.description: Blasting data centers into orbit would come with its own challenges and potential advantages, but Musk says SpaceX is going to do it.

item.title: Cybercriminals are stooping to a new low by targeting job seekers when the market is already bad: ‘Where’s the good sheep for the wolf to go attack?’
item.description: DNSFilter found 8,724 malicious domains containing the word “jobs,” with the overwhelming majority (86%) newly registered or observed.

item.title: Business Leaders Are Looking Inward to Bridge Talent Gaps
item.description: Companies are increasingly hiring internally to fill open roles.

item.title: Walmart CEO said paying its star managers upwards of $620,000 yearly empowered them to ‘feel like owners’
item.description: From Rolls-Royce to Volkswagen, companies are betting big on pay hikes to fix culture—because money still talks.

item.title: Daymond John Reveals the Number One Reason New Businesses Don’t Survive
item.description: The FUBU founder and ‘Shark Tank’ star shared his favorite advice for entrepreneurs.

item.title: Stock futures climb as investors await Supreme Court showdown on Trump tariffs and shareholder vote on Musk’s $1 trillion pay package
item.description: On Thursday, Tesla shareholders will gather for the company’s annual meeting and will vote on Musk’s $1 trillion compensation package.

item.title: How Trump’s AI deepfakes fit perfectly into his “flood the zone” disinfo strategy
